result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quentin Romel Scott Sr

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:16 AM Defendant Quentin Romel Scott Sr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Quentin Romel Scott Sr.  Attorney David S Olson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Mathew Christidis of the Rock County Sheriff's Office sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Substitution of Judge filed. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty, remand to branch 2 for scheduling of Judge. Bond to continue.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing on Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment on October 25, 2022 at 9:30AM-NOT RECEIVED TIMELY TO FORWARD (Quentin Scott Sr)
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:36 AM Defendant Quentin Romel Scott Sr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Quentin Romel Scott Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Per attorney Bricco states witness was served, but not present. Attorney Bricco calls Deputy Viengkhone Nousansacksy of the Rock County Sheriff's Office sworn testimony taken by video; witness identified the defendant. Court continues preliminary hearing by zoom for state's witness to be present.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:34 PM Defendant Quentin Romel Scott Sr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Quentin Romel Scott Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim by audio. Jessica Baker by audio for victim witness office. Preliminary requested by zoom and scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 9:30 AM.
Notice of Hearing for Preliminary Hearing on September 27, 2022 at 8:30am, ATTEMPTED NOT KNOWN, UNABLE TO FORWARD, RETURN TO SENDER (Defendant Quentin Romel Scott Sr.)

8:31AM Defendant Quentin Romel Scott Sr appeared by video in custody.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like counsel. Court finds good cause to continue Preliminary Hearing. Defendant to contact State Public Defender Office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:13 PM Defendant Quentin Romel Scott Sr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Quentin Romel Scott Sr.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $500.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with Rock Valley Community Program or its employees. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant is now stating he is not this person. Court schedules preliminary hearing by zoom as defendant will no longer speak on matter. Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 8:30AM.

No contact directly or indirectly with Rock Valley Community Program or its employees. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
